options.responseText: *The ghoul cackles, licking cracked lips.* Stitch is the name. Used to draw, now I pick turnips for Mister Greaves over there. Life’s funny, ain’t it?

followUpOptions.responseText: Yeah. Did covers for sleaze rags—*Mutant Lust*, *Robo-Tarts of Venus*, that kinda thing. Big hips and more cleavage than plot. Sold like Med-X in a Raider den. Now I sketch ghouls getting railed by Mirelurks in the dirt. Still got the touch—just no audience.

When the boss ain’t lookin'. Scratch out filth in the mud with a fingerbone. Got one piece of *La Fantoma* riding a Behemoth in a bikini made of Radroach wings. Masterpiece. Blew it away in the wind like a fart in a sandstorm.
Escape? From what, meatbag? The chains? The farm? The *mind*? Heh... Even if I ran, the rot would follow.
Freedom’s just slavery with more choices. Least here I know who owns me.
Takes one to know one, shiny. We all wear chains—mine just jingle louder.
Would you now? And what then? You think freedom’s gonna fix *this*?' *He taps his skull, then his chest.* The rot runs deep, friend.
She’s mine, yeah. Name’s Lucy. Six-stringed lady—probably the cleanest thing I ever fingered. Found her in a corpse wagon ten years back. Strings were gut, real gut.
Still can. Still *do*. When the moon’s low and the master's passed out drunk. I pluck til my fingers bleed—makes the sound warmer.
*Stitch picks up Lucy, fingers trembling. He strums a haunting, off-key tune.*

followUpOptions.optionText: Why not sell it and get outta here?
followUpOptions.responseText: Sell Lucy? That’s like sellin’ your mother. Or your daughter. Nah... I’ll die with her... and maybe she’ll hum over my bones.

options.optionText: Who’s the guy with the shotgun?
options.responseText: Oh, that? That’s Mr. Greaves. Keeper of the crops and my lovely leash. Say hi, Daddy!
Leave fast, fresh meat. I start gnawin' if I get bored.
